title: Do students have to study biology in IITs? - Quora
tags: Studying at Indian Institutes of Technology

response.answer_text: Yes, during first year B.tech. their is a course of biology in any one of the two semesters covering few topics about cell biology, proteins and amino acids, etc.

If you are opting for Biotechnology or Biological sciences and Bioengineering or Biotechnology and Biochemical Engineering or Agricultural and Food Engineering then you have to study biology. For other courses offered by IITs Biology is not compulsory. Hope it helps :) Sahil Gupta
Yes. There is a basic biology course which all btechs need to do for sure. Apart from that you can do some bio courses out of interest. This is the case in at least IIT Bombay.
I am not sure about any other IIT''s but here at IITD all the BTechs do have to take an elementary level course on Biology. We actually have to take an elementary courses from almost all branches.
